alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 9:37PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Near-record temperatures Sunday caused more high elevation snowmelt, and this water will make its way through area streams and rivers overnight and into the day Monday. Expect streams and rivers to run high and fast over the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...River flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Fremont. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Those affected by high flows Saturday night and Sunday morning are likely to see another round of high flows tonight into Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 926 PM MDT, river gauges report numerous locations in excess of Action Stage, indicating flows at or above bankfull. Additionally, local officials indicated snowmelt leading to flooding issues around Lander, WY. Minor flooding is ongoing and is expected to continue for the Popo Agie and Little Wind River Drainages.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Campers and hikers should avoid making camp near streams or creeks.
